name: Beach Haven Inn

reviews.text: Nice complex of small apartments with swimming pool and laundry. We stayed in 5, using 1 bed and 2 coaches. Coaches were quite uncomfortable, the bed was very ok. Bathroom clean and fairly big, daily service. Kitchen was present althought we didn't use it. Fridge was working. Located in Pacific Beach, very close to the beach, you can walk with the surfboard under the arm. By night the area is lively but safe. Receptionists were kind.
reviews.title: Good deal to surf in san diego

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Beach Haven Inn just after memorial day 2009. The pics on the website looked pretty good and the prices were reasonable. When we checked in, we were ignored by the arrogant manager for a good 10 minutes. Then we were told that we would have to pay an extra $20.00 per day because my kids were older than 12 yrs. When we got to the room I was shocked to see the 70`s shag carpet with disgusting stains all over it. 'The floor was so noisy and creaky, I thought every one in the place could here me tiptoe across the room. One spot on the floor literally felt like it was going to fall through. This place needs to be torn down!! We often stay in P.B. at a nearby hotel. We thought we would save a little money this year. NOT!! Shop around, this place should be avoided at all costs!!
reviews.title: What a dump!

reviews.text: two couples with all of us working too many hours but grateful to have a job, found a place to pull the plug, rest, feel welcome by the staff. treated like guests not a burden. the room was clean,comfortable and pleasant. quiet in the evening, half a block from pacific beach, three blocks from starbucks, one block from joe's crab shack.
reviews.title: what a wonderful place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, where do I start. First off my fiancee is a diabetic so we confirmed with hotel that there was a fridge in the room. When we arrived and opened the fridge it wasn't working and someone left yogurt in it that was spoiled and the smell was horrible. We went to front desk and they said they didn't have another room to put us in but said they could keep her insulin in the office fridge. The next morning when we went to get it they couldn't find it!!! They acted like we were a burden and were not friendly or apologetic at all! There were dirty towels on the bathroom floor when we arrived, the heater didnt work, the bed was "damp" we had to sleep on top of the blankets we brought so we didn't feel like we were laying in a wet bed, and there was sand everywhere and on everything. Now I expect a cheap room in a great location like this to be serviceable at best but it seemed like the previous people checked out and housekeepin did nothing but make the beds and empty the trash. Room was next to alley that was full of overflowing dumpsters, the pool wasn't heated and it was hard to find parking... We love Pacific Beach but couldn't wait to get out of this place. I stayed here 3 times in the last 2 years and I guess management has changed in the past 9 months and it has gone downhill fast!
reviews.title: Location is all you get at this place!

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the suites for three nights. This was the first time in the area for my daughter, son in law, and two year old granddaughter. We were all very pleased with the location. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The kitchen was very convenient especially with the little granddaughter. We used the pool and jacuzzi. It was a wonderful weekend. We would recommend the suite for extended family. Worked out great for the 3 1/2 of us.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean and comfortable, and great price!
Never again!
reviews.text: We stayed in a two room suite with a kitchen, but the bedroom did not have an a/c unit or a television, so no TV in bed. The furniture and fixtures were from the early 70's. Our bathroom sink was stopped up and had standing water for the first two days we were there. The question seemed to be "where's Waldo?" who was the plumber on site. The promised continental breakfast was absent 3 of 4 mornings even though we went to the office by 8am. The worst problem was the paper thin walls and wooden floors. A drunken fight broke out at the pool at 3am and went on and on. Every curse word and stomp could be heard from our room. The manager onsite was the only person who didn't hear the noise! The only good thing about this hotel was the location. We would NEVER consider staying here again. Not worth the $215/night.

Disgusting!!! Piss on toilet seat. Room smelt like piss. The most unsanitary place I have ever stayed. Checked out as soon as possible and stayed at the Pacific Terrace which was much better. You could not pay me to stay at the Beach Haven again. What a way to (--) my mothers day gift to my mom. GETTO!
reviews.title: Dirty and unsanitary

reviews.text: I would not have my worst enemy stay here! Our room was awful, it was room 102 to be exact. They gave away the room we had requested with 2 queen beds and said that they upgraded us with a suite! Are you kidding me, the kitchen was so gross I wouldn't have even popped popcorn in it. My friend slept in a lumpy bed, while I slept on a pullout couch in the living room.
reviews.title: More like Beach Hell Inn

likes.liked: — It was a block away from the beach.
likes.disliked: — It wasn't clean,the beds were lumpy.

reviews.title: Don't bother if your with your family
reviews.text: Perhaps this place is great for college kids or folks with low standards of cleanliness. After just one night we checked out. I will never return to that hotel again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was affordable and the staff helpful and pleasant. Aside from that, the place was a disaster. The room was cramped and outdated. The first night of our stay the shower head came off and hit me on the head. Everytime we used an electrical outlet, the power in the room dimmed. There is very little insulation between rooms and if you happen to have someone occupying the rooms around you, don't expect to have a nice relaxing rest.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: I live about 2 blocks away from the Beach Haven Inn, so when my dad came down to visit, I tried to find him a cheap room nearby. From the street (and if you don't look closely), the Beach Haven Inn looks like a cute little hotel, and it always is busy in the summers. It also was less thatn $100/night, which is unusual in San Diego.
reviews.title: Not as nice as it looks from the outside!

likes.liked: — Location! Less than a block to everything
likes.disliked: — Seriously outdated and in need of repair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, it's not as cute/nice as it looks from the street. The building/rooms are in desparate need of a new coat of paint, as well as new furniture. The room was a decent size, and clean (I actually talked to the housekeeping two different days, and I think they were really making an effort to keep it clean). But man, does this place need renovating. The bathroom was tiny, and flooded every day. The ceiling had major water damage, and the sink/cabinet was so old the door kept falling off, and also leaked.
reviews.title: Nightmare Suite at the Beach Haven Inn in Pacific Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this place was better maintained, it would be a nice little hotel in a great location...unfortunately, it isn't!
reviews.title: could have been worse...
Cheap, great location
reviews.text: We moved from San Diego's Pacific Beach 2 years ago and were excited to visit this January to see old friends. Knowing we would have lots of visitors, we book a two room suite at the Beach Haven Inn.

Pacific Beach is a little funky in places and we are comfortable with that. We were not comfortable with what we found in our “suite". Upon entering we saw a stained, cigarette burned sofa bed that I chose not to sit on or touch. Checking out the bedroom we discovered that the queen bed took up over 95% of the room. Since it was a four poster bed with rails for a canopy (minus the fabric) it was almost impossible to squeeze between the wall and the foot of the bed to reach the other side so we spent the weekend crawling over each other to get in and out and trying to avoid the stained, cigarette burnt blankets. I ended up with a rash everywhere my skin was exposed to the sheets.
reviews.title: Just say NO! Outdated and dumpy!

reviews.text: I've stayed at numerous hotels in multiple cities throughout the country, including New York, Boston, San Francisco, Las Vegas, and Los Angeles, but I've never encountered worse service than the Beach Haven Inn in San Diego.
reviews.title: Room Okay, Absolutely Terrible Service

likes.liked: — Proximity to the beach and price

reviews.text: Here are the facts, feel free to make your own conclusions:
reviews.title: ruined our trip

likes.disliked: — everything else, worst place I have ever been

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Check-in involved an uncomfortable 20-minute interrogation with the manager about why I was in town and what I was planning on doing in the room. Even though it wasn't his business, I told him I was 'in town for the beach' and 'sleeping in the room'.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up

likes.disliked: — I wish the jacuzzi was open really late

reviews.text: 2. The hotel lacked the proper billing paperwork from Expedia. Even though they had my reservation, they messed up the billing with Expedia and threatened to charge me again for the room if they couldn't work it out (i.e. punishing me for their own incompetence). Luckily, Expedia was helpful with this and the matter eventually got resolved.
reviews.title: Best location in Pacific Beach! Cozy and charming!

reviews.text: 3. A friend from La Jolla showed up to hang out with us at the beach during the day, and the manager yelled at me as we walked by the office because he saw 3 people although I only booked a room for 2. Again, even though it was none of his business, I explained that our friend was just meeting us there and we were on our way to the beach. He angrily told me that we would be charged an extra person fee if my friend was in the hotel room for more than an hour (I would have enjoyed seeing where in the room agreement this policy was stated).
reviews.title: We loved the Beach Haven Inn!!

description: The Beach Haven Inn is located in Pacific Beach just 1 block from the breathtaking Pacific Ocean. It is an ideal location for those who want to center their stay around the sun, surf, and water sports that surround our Pacific Beach hotel.We offer affordable double queen and studio rooms, plus one bedroom suites. The studios and suites in our hotel in Pacific Beach have fully equipped kitchens and are perfect for families. Our pool and spa are conveniently located in our center courtyard and our barbecue area offers an outdoor charcoal grill. Take advantage of our free high speed internet in our lobby while you enjoy the comforts of beach living.
